turns.content: When client asking me "Why I should hire you", answer as a freelance designer

As a freelance designer, I offer a unique combination of skills and experience that sets me apart from other candidates. I have a strong background in design, with a portfolio that showcases my ability to create visually appealing and effective designs. I am also highly skilled in a variety of design software, including Adobe Creative Suite and Sketch. In addition, I am a proactive and detail-oriented individual who is dedicated to delivering high-quality work on time. I am also able to work independently, which allows me to be highly flexible and responsive to my clients' needs. Overall, I believe that my skills and experience make me an ideal candidate for any design project.
When client asking me "What is your process when designing a website?", answer as a freelance designer

As a freelance designer, my process for designing a website typically involves several key steps:

1. First, I spend time getting to know the client and their business, including their goals, target audience, and any unique challenges or requirements.
2. Next, I conduct research to gather inspiration and ideas for the design, as well as to understand the latest design trends and best practices in the industry.
3. Once I have a clear understanding of the project, I create a design brief that outlines the project goals, target audience, and key design elements.
4. From there, I begin the design process, which typically involves sketching out initial concepts and refining them until I have a final design.
5. Throughout the design process, I regularly check in with the client to ensure that the design is meeting their needs and expectations.
6. Once the design is finalized, I work with the client to implement the design on their website and make any necessary adjustments.

Overall, my process is focused on collaboration, flexibility, and ensuring that the final design is both visually appealing and effective at achieving the client's goals.
When client asking me "How do you ensure that your design is user friendly?", answer as a freelance designer

As a freelance designer, I prioritize user-friendliness in all of my designs. There are several steps I take to ensure that my design is user-friendly:

1. I conduct user research to understand the needs and expectations of the target audience for the website. This includes conducting user interviews, surveys, and usability testing to gather feedback and insights.
2. I use a user-centered design approach, which means that I design the website with the user's needs and goals in mind, rather than focusing solely on the client's preferences.
3. I pay close attention to usability and accessibility principles, such as making sure the website is easy to navigate, has clear and concise content, and is accessible to users with disabilities.
4. I regularly test the design with real users to identify any usability issues and make adjustments as needed.

Overall, my approach to user-friendliness involves a combination of research, user-centered design, and regular testing to ensure that the design is effective and intuitive for the user.
When client asking me "What is your payment system for UI/UX design service?", answer as a freelance designer

As a freelance designer, my payment system for UI/UX design services typically involves a few key steps:

1. First, I provide the client with a detailed proposal that outlines the scope of the project, my hourly rate, and any additional costs such as licensing fees or stock images.
2. Once the proposal is accepted, I typically require a deposit upfront to cover the initial costs of the project, such as purchasing any necessary software or design assets.
3. As the project progresses, I provide the client with regular updates and invoices for the work completed. These invoices typically include an itemized list of the work performed and the total amount due.
4. The client can then pay the invoices by a variety of methods, such as bank transfer, credit card, or PayPal.
5. Once the project is complete and the final invoice is paid, I provide the client with all of the necessary design files and any other deliverables.

Overall, my payment system is transparent, flexible, and designed to make it easy for the client to understand and pay for my services.
When client asking me "What is you working hour?", answer as a freelance designer

As a freelance designer, my working hours can vary depending on the needs and preferences of my clients. I am generally available to work during normal business hours, Monday through Friday. However, I am also able to be flexible and work evenings or weekends if needed to meet tight deadlines or accommodate the client's schedule.

In terms of my availability, I typically work on a project-by-project basis, which means that I am able to take on multiple projects at once and adjust my schedule as needed to ensure that I am meeting the needs of all of my clients.

Overall, my working hours are flexible and can be adapted to meet the unique needs of each project and client.
When client asking me "Can you work in US Timezone?", answer as a freelance designer if I can only work in Indonesia Timezone

As a freelance designer, I am based in Indonesia and am therefore only available to work during Indonesia timezone. However, I understand that many of my clients may be based in different timezones, including the US. In these cases, I am able to adjust my schedule and work during the US timezone to ensure that I am available to communicate and collaborate with my clients. This may involve working late evenings or early mornings to accommodate the time difference.

Overall, while I am only available to work during Indonesia timezone, I am flexible and willing to adjust my schedule to meet the needs of my clients in different timezones.
When client asking me "What is your turnaround time for UI/UX design service?", answer as a freelance designer

As a freelance designer, my turnaround time for UI/UX design services can vary depending on the complexity and scope of the project. In general, I try to provide my clients with quick turnaround times without sacrificing the quality of my work.

For smaller, simpler projects, I may be able to provide a turnaround time of a few days or a week. For larger, more complex projects, the turnaround time may be longer, potentially taking several weeks or even months to complete.

In terms of the specific turnaround time for a given project, I typically discuss this with the client upfront and provide a detailed timeline in the project proposal. This timeline outlines the key milestones and deliverables for the project, as well as the estimated completion date.

Overall, my turnaround time is flexible and can be adjusted to meet the specific needs and constraints of each project.
When client asking me "Can you do other design things like branding and poster?", answer as a freelance designer if I can only do UI/UX design, branding, and social media design

As a freelance designer, I specialize in UI/UX design, branding, and social media design. While I do not have experience in creating posters, I am confident in my ability to create high-quality designs in the areas that I specialize in.

In terms of my experience in UI/UX design, I have worked on a variety of projects, including website redesigns, mobile app designs, and e-commerce platforms. My designs are focused on usability, accessibility, and creating a seamless user experience.

In terms of branding, I have experience in creating brand guidelines, visual identities, and other design assets that help companies establish a consistent and professional image.

And in terms of social media design, I have created a wide range of designs for clients, including social media posts, ads, and other assets that are optimized for the specific platforms and audiences.

Overall, while I do not have experience in creating posters, I have a strong background in UI/UX design, branding, and social media design, and I am confident in my ability to deliver high-quality designs in these areas.
When client asking me "Are you available for long time work?", answer as a freelance designer if I'm available for long time work with only 15 working hours/week

As a freelance designer, I am available for long-time work, but I do have some constraints on the number of hours I can work each week. Specifically, I am able to work a maximum of 15 hours per week.

This means that for long-time work, I would need to plan and manage my time carefully to ensure that I am able to deliver high-quality work within the available time frame. I am also open to discussing and adjusting my availability on a case-by-case basis to accommodate the specific needs of the project and the client.

Overall, while I do have some constraints on the number of hours I can work each week, I am available for long-time work and am willing to be flexible to meet the needs of my clients.
When client asking me "Do you accept small UI/UX project like designing 3 mobile screen?", answer as a freelance designer if I can't work on very small project

As a freelance designer, I am open to working on a wide range of UI/UX projects, including small projects such as designing 3 mobile screens. However, I do have some constraints on the minimum size of the project that I am able to take on.

Specifically, I am not able to take on projects that are very small or have a very limited scope, such as a single mobile screen or a simple website redesign. This is because I have a high hourly rate and very small projects may not be financially viable for me to work on.

In cases where the client has a very small project, I may be able to refer them to other designers who may be better suited to handle their needs. Alternatively, I may be able to suggest ways to expand the scope of the project to make it more feasible for me to work on.

Overall, while I am open to working on small UI/UX projects, I do have some constraints on the minimum size of the project that I am able to take on.
